sub_title: 🇪🇺Lobbyist | ISU Mentor | Erasmus+ Coordinator | HAN’s Employee at Mobility Innovation Center
summary:
Enthusiastic, social entrepreneurial spirit, sustainable global matchmaker, youth counselor, certified supervisor, space mentor and accredited European lobbyist, results-oriented that is achieved by quickly switching and achieving the maximum result.

By using knowledge and influence in combination with persuasive power, taking into account the objectives of the stakeholders.

Creative, not 9 to 5 mentality, "Spider in the Web", open attitude, honest, friendly with sense of humor. Enjoy the challenge and continually strive for personal improvement.

As legal representative and international project coordinator, I carry the responsibility of planning, organizing, implementing and running (KA1, KA2 & KA3) Erasmus+ projects, throughout and involving multiple member states of Europe.

SKILLS
• Good at initiating, coordinating & implementing EU projects / programs
• Alert to calls for local, regional, national & international projects
• Disciplined, confident, good persuasiveness, effective & efficient
• Excellent analytical skills, loyal, committed & has a good sense of humour
• Open attitude, dedication & is a solid team player but also able to work as an individual

treasury_media.title: Students gain innovative practical experiences within the automotive and engineering industry
treasury_media.description: HAN technical students gain innovative practical experiences in the Mobility Innovation Center (MIC) specially developed for this purpose on the IPKW site in Arnhem. They learn about and work on appealing projects, such as electric or self-driving vehicles, but also about sustainability in transport. The emphasis is on applying theoretical knowledge in practical situations. Which projects will these students work on in their third semester?

treasury_media.title: Dutch people in the Brussels bubble | Lobbyist Aleksandr Stommels wants to connect people
treasury_media.description: Although it is certainly important to stay informed about what is happening in #Brussels, the #Dutch EU lobbyist Aleksandr Stommels mainly wants to bring people and projects together.

treasury_media.title: EU Centre for Space Economy & Commerce Member at ESA - European Space Agency.
DUO Youth Council 2022 - 2023
treasury_media.description: Who does the DUO Youth Council consist of? We are a young group of enthusiastic counselors that provides DUO (Dienst Uitvoering Onderwijs) with solicited and unsolicited advice on a diversity of student affairs!

treasury_media.title: EU Centre for Space Law Member at ESA - European Space Agency.
To UN climate summit with young climate lobbyists
treasury_media.description:
We hear enough about politicians at the climate conference in Egypt. But there in the corridors and meeting rooms of the UN climate summit (COP27) you will also find countless young people who have a say about their future. And sometimes even much louder than politicians dare, they tell it like it is.

This includes the Dutch Scarlett Karoleva and Tomas Friedhoff of Circle of Sustainable Europe (CoSE). In Egypt, these lobbyists spoke to various organizations and politicians about the importance of young people's political participation. They know what Prime Minister Mark Rutte must do to become “Olympic Climate Champion” in 2030.

treasury_media.title: What does a lobbyist actually do?
treasury_media.description: People often ask me this question - in terms of what activities a lobbyist regularly performs. They are always surprised when I explain how much research and desk-work is involved. This illustration is a nice overview of what we do in our daily work - in a nutshell.

treasury_media.title: NVR Young Professionals Committee
treasury_media.description: Over the past few months, nine enthusiastic NVR members have gathered to form the NVR Young Professionals Committee. Our goal is to connect, inspire and support young space professionals within the Netherlands.

awards.title: 1 van de 200 genomineerden voor de DJ100 van 2017, 2018 & 2019
awards.description: De Duurzame Jonge 100 geeft een overzicht van jonge ondernemers, young professionals en studenten die aantonen dat een duurzame toekomst mogelijk is. Deze koplopers zijn een bron van inspiratie voor elkaar en voor de gevestigde orde!

awards.title: 1 van de 400 genomineerden van 20’25 Youth Challenge
Representant
awards.description:
Ereveld Vol Leven vond plaats op Nationaal Ereveld Loenen.
We konden daarbij rekenen op mensen zoals ik, die aangeboden hadden achter een grafsteen te staan en het oorlogsslachtoffer wat daar ligt begraven, op die manier een gezicht te geven.

Nationaal Ereveld Loenen werd op die manier letterlijk gevuld met leven. We hebben deze dag niet alleen stil gestaan bij het verlies van al deze mensen, maar ook bij hun leven.
We hebben hun verhalen verteld, hun geschiedenis gedeeld. We hebben stil gestaan bij wie ze waren en wat hen is overkomen. Maar liefst vijfentwintig verhalen hebben we kunnen delen. Allemaal verschillend en toch ook allemaal een beetje gelijk. Want alle verhalen gaan over een zwaar verlies. Op het Ereveld werken we met mensen. Een steen is slechts een steen, meer niet. Maar als daar een mens staat, iemand zoals jij en ik, dan raakt het je als bezoeker en als representant. Dan voelen we het verlies.
 
Wat we met het Ereveld doen, is proberen iets van dat verlies zichtbaar maken. We maken van de aantallen, van de cijfers en de grafstenen, weer mensen. En dat is afgelopen maandag 1 mei, tijdens Ereveld Vol Leven 2017, prachtig gelukt.

awards.title: Rolmodel
awards.description:
De Sociale Troonrede laat zien dat er door heel Nederland heen mensen bezig zijn om de wereld een stukje mooier te maken. Bijvoorbeeld op het gebied van zorg, duurzaamheid of werk. 

Als rolmodel vind ik dat ondernemers nog wel wat meer mogen samenwerken om écht verschil te kunnen maken. Hoe maak jij het verschil?

awards.title: Winnaar DAB+ radio
awards.description: Bij een NOS wedstrijd "Wie is de opvolger van Eric Corton?" werd ik vanuit 458 kandidaten geselecteerd als winnaar van de DAB+ radio en een live uitzending bij "Met het Oog op Morgen'' (met Wilfried de Jong).

projects.title: Generic Green Investment Planner for Professionals using Satellite Imagery
projects.description:
Generic Green Investment Planner for Professionals using Satellite Imagery: a tool to find, qualify, quantify, prioritise green investing opportunities.

💎IDEA
A lot of land is unused and has potential to be used as solar farms. The tool will find these empty lands and qualify and quantity it for use and prioritise between options for solar panel placement. 

🛰️EU SPACE TECHNOLOGIES
The tool uses COPERNICUS data to find unused land. These locations are checked against legal maps and solar illumination maps to assess the suitability. It overlays different maps and extracts useful information.

🏦 SPACE FOR THE FINANCIAL WORLD
Both challenge 1 and 2 are being tackled. A tool is developed to be used by professional investors and project developers for sustainable developments.

projects.title: Innovatie agenda 'Ieder Talent Telt'​
projects.description:
De gemeente en bestuurders van alle opvang en onderwijsorganisaties in Nijmegen werken samen aan de innovatie-agenda 'Ieder Talent Telt'. Door de aanwezigheid van grote instellingen voor middelbaar en hoger beroepsonderwijs en de universiteit heeft de stad Nijmegen een relatief jonge en hoogopgeleide bevolking. Gezamenlijk zijn zij goed voor 50.000 studenten! Nijmegen is een stad die jonge mensen kansen wil bieden en die de talenten van jonge mensen wil benutten. Zij zijn een bron van creativiteit, ondernemerschap, culturele activiteit en innovatie. Dit reikt verder van economische concurrentiekracht. Het gaat ook om vitaliteit en sociale kracht van de inwoners van de stad en de regio. Tegelijkertijd heeft Nijmegen ook meer traditionele economische sectoren en speelt laaggeschoold werk een belangrijke rol. 

 De kracht van Nijmegen ligt in het verbinden: van jong en oud, van traditioneel en innovatief, van hoog en lager opgeleid. Iedereen telt mee en doet mee! Uniek voor Nijmegen is de intensieve samenwerking tussen de onderwijsinstellingen. Als het gaat om het verbinden willen we nog meer aan kracht winnen door samen te werken aan doorlopende talentontwikkeling van alle kinderen en jongeren. Daarvoor is samenwerking nodig tussen onderwijs - welzijn - zorginstellingen en het bedrijfsleven. 

 We zijn erop gericht om op een ontwikkelingsgerichte wijze mensen samen te brengen om de eigen talenten in te zetten om er zorg voor te dragen dat 'ieder talent telt'! Daarvoor hebben we diverse broedplaatsen ingericht. De broedplaatsen bestaan uit nieuwe initiatieven waarbinnen professionals (onderwijs - welzijn - zorg en bedrijfsleven), studenten en scholieren, ouders en burgers samenwerken. Deze broedplaatsen dienen als proeftuinen voor innovatie gericht op doorlopende talentontwikkeling van kinderen en jongeren.

projects.title: Jongeren- en Studenten-Blok bij Stop Foute Handelsverdragen
projects.description:
Wij jongeren en studenten laten onze stem gezamenlijk horen op 22 oktober TEGEN foute handelsverdragen en VOOR een eerlijke economie. Dit gaat om ónze toekomst! Samen vormen we één blok, vóórop in de demonstratie vanaf het Museumplein: https://www.facebook.com/events/1142084455871884/

Stop foute handelsverdragen
Manifestatie voor duurzame en eerlijke handel

De Nederlandse regering staat op het punt allerlei foute handelsverdragen te tekenen. TTIP, CETA en TiSA zetten onze toekomst op het spel. Sluit je aan bij onze beweging en kies voor een duurzame economie, echte banen en veilig voedsel, boven de belangen van grote bedrijven.

Kom op 22 oktober naar het Museumplein in Amsterdam, want NU kun jij deze foute handelsverdragen nog stoppen.

*Wat staat er op het spel?*

We moeten ons NU laten horen voor een duurzame en eerlijke economie.

TTIP is het vergaande handelsverdrag met de VS, dat de toekomst van ons voedsel, klimaat en werk bedreigt. Over TTIP wordt achter gesloten deuren onderhandeld. Het verzet groeit nog steeds, TTIP wankelt en wij kunnen de genadeslag geven.

CETA is de Canadese variant van TTIP, en staat op het punt getekend te worden. CETA bedreigt op dezelfde manier onze economie en democratie. Daarnaast is CETA TTIP via de achterdeur, want 80% van de Amerikaanse bedrijven zit ook in Canada en kan dan zo tóch Europa in komen.

TiSA is een internationaal dienstenverdrag, dat onze zorg en ons onderwijs, onze energie en ons water in de uitverkoop doet. TiSA levert onze publieke diensten uit aan de markt.

Kom met ons in actie. Als we deze foute handelsverdragen NU niet stoppen, schrijven multinationals ons de wet voor. Kom op 22 oktober naar het Museumplein in Amsterdam en stop foute handelsverdragen.

Deze demonstratie wordt onder andere georganiseerd door de FNV, Greenpeace, Transnational Institute, foodwatch, SOMO, Milieudefensie en de Consumentenbond.

projects.title: Meldpunt Geen Stage
projects.description:
Een diploma halen is heel belangrijk. Geen stage kunnen vinden mag daarvoor geen belemmering zijn. 
Door het aansnijden van een taart opende wethouder Turgay Tankir samen met Hanneke Berben, Roelf Jager en met mij het Meldpunt Geen Stage. Bij dit meldpunt kun je terecht als je geen stage kunt vinden. De Gemeente Nijmegen wil graag weten hoe vaak dat voorkomt en wat de oorzaak is. Daarnaast helpen ze je dan op weg!

profile_positions.description:
The Mobility Innovation Center (MIC) connects HAN's education and practice-oriented research with the need for innovation and business development of the business community. Innovations are not only realized, but it also brings the business community closer to the employees of the future.

The direct collaboration between company employees, lecturer-researchers and students creates a learning community in which, in addition to the students, knowledge institutions and people from the field learn.

The MIC is currently still located in building TB at the Industriepark Kleefse Waard (IPKW), but will become part of Connectr - Energy Innovation.

The Powerlab is a dynamic stage and facility area that can be used by both HAN and the business community.

Powerlab supports working in the triangle and connects education to entrepreneurs and research together with ESBE (Energy for Sustainable Built Environment). This helps the transition to a new energy world with more and better equipped students, starting entrepreneurs and ensures that the distance between employers and employees is reduced.

The Powerlab has a beautiful large open space where masterclasses, courses, presentations, brainstorming sessions and events can be held. There is a separate instruction room to give lessons.
profile_positions.title: Mobility Innovation Center Employee & Powerlab Admin | HAN Engineering & Automotive

profile_positions.description:
Under the name IMAGINE, a Green Office community is being built by HAN employees and students around the Global Goals, the 17 Sustainable Development Goals of the United Nations (UN).

These world goals were set by the United Nations (UN) in 2015 to strive for the realization of a sustainable global society by 2030, based on respect for nature, universal human rights, economic and social justice.

Because education plays a central and innovative role in the challenges facing society, team IMAGINE opens in a new window wants to establish an inspiring community for "Global Change". This community is aimed at connecting initiatives around the 17 Global Goals in order to further knowledge sharing and knowledge creation on these themes. The community is formed by citizens of the world from education, research and the professional field from within and outside HAN! 

HAN Experience Centre - Green Office is a platform for sustainability where students and employees can work together to make HAN more sustainable. The aim is to increase awareness of sustainability and to involve students and employees in this. Experience Centre - Green Office can ensure that sustainable initiatives within HAN become more visible and is the contact point in the field of sustainability for students and employees.

Together with the HAN, we are looking at opportunities to build an Experience Centre – Green Office with the help of our growing community and support from our network.
profile_positions.title: Experience Centre - Green Office Co-Initiator & Counselor

profile_positions.description:
As a selected mentor of the ISU Mentorship Program, this is a perfect opportunity for me to share my knowledge and experience with newly-coming members of the ISU community, while helping them to boost their careers and establishing long-lasting connections in the space sector.

The Space Studies Program (SSP), a curriculum designed for young graduates, professionals starting or changing emphasis in their space careers or for persons working in space-related fields who wish to broaden their knowledge and understanding beyond their current discipline. https://mentorship.isunet.edu/ssp22/

SSP21: Granada, Spain
SSP22: Oeiras, Portugal
SSP23: São José dos Campos, Brazil
SSP24: Houston, Texas, USA
profile_positions.title: Alumni & Space Studies Program Mentor

profile_positions.description:
• In charge of the main CoSE office; thus, working with minimal supervision while being responsible over high-level issues of global importance.
• Head of CoSE delegation to (KA1, KA2 & KA3) Erasmus+ projects. Actively participating in various EU meetings & regularly making statements at the plenary sessions.
• Coordinated youth EU activities around the world through supervising work of Coordinators & Representatives.
• Performed extensive research work on EU policy issues.
• Organized international, national, regional, & local conferences, workshops, & meetings.  
• Overseen the development & design of the CoSE website.
• In charge of PR & communications for CoSE: website, social media, mailing lists, newsletter, dissemination of information.

As Legal Entity Appointed Representative (LEAR) Responsible for: 
(1) keeping an overview of all EU proposals/projects/contracts CoSE is involved in
(2) managing all legal & financial information
(3) managing access rights to the EU portal at organisation-level (& read-only access at project-level)
(4) appointing the persons able to electronically sign grants/contracts (Legal Signatories — LSIGNs) & cost claims/invoices (Financial Signatories — FSIGNs)

2022: By request of Hague University of Applied Sciences I coordinate with my research team European Studies Students. Group will focus on lobbying in The Hague and on Brussels.

CoSE is the leading ngo combining, connecting and creating environmental sustainability projects across Europe with a Top-Down & Bottom-Up approach. As an umbrella organization its aim is to expand knowledge and awareness of today’s biggest climate change challenges. It does so by supporting cooperation between international, national, regional and local initiatives aiming to address the SDG’s set out by the UN, and by providing these initiatives with a voice at European level.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder, President, Legal Entity Appointed Representative & Erasmus+ Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
• The European Parliament is an important forum for political debate and decision-making at the EU level. The Members of the European Parliament are directly elected by voters in all Member States to represent people’s interests with regard to EU law-making and to make sure other EU institutions are working democratically.

• As a Lobbyist, I advocate "Top-Down" for the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG's) set out by the United Nations in Paris in 2015. Themes I address: Sustainable Practices, Social Entrepreneurship, Mindset Education, Youth Empowerment, and Exponential Technologies for the benefit of the human condition. 

• As a Community Leader, I coordinate "Bottom-Up" events, gatherings and projects. Themes I address: Social Engagement, Local Innovation, Inclusivity - respect and trust, and Diversity - enhancing creativity. This is to strengthen communities from various backgrounds to collaborate using various skills and talents. 

• 'Lobbying' (also 'lobby') is a form of advocacy with the intention of influencing decisions made by the government by individuals or more usually by lobby groups; it includes all attempts to influence legislators and officials, whether by other legislators, constituents, or organized groups. A 'lobbyist' is a person who tries to influence legislation on behalf of a special interest or a member of a lobby.
profile_positions.title: Accredited EU Lobbyist

profile_positions.description:
Holland House was established on 4 July 2014: the house for the Dutch community in the heart of Europe. A meeting place for representatives of companies, governments and social organizations. The Dutch input and thoughts in Europe are given free rein here. Meeting, deepening and creativity are the keywords for success.

Holland House will be furnished in a building on Rue d'Arlon (Arlon Street) that overlooks "Place Lux". This is Place du Luxembourg (Luxembourg Square) located within walking distance of the Commission, Council and European Parliament, so at the center of all EU activities.

With the kick-off of Orange Art House, as a new voice in the Brussels art and cultural landscape, Holland House Brussels wants to contribute to the introduction, dialogue and promotion of Dutch art and culture in Belgium, and in Brussels, the seat of the institutions. of the European Union. Orange Art House (of Holland House Brussels) received a contribution from the Dutch Embassy in Belgium for the organization of the exhibition 'New Space(s)'.

Dutch Network Brussels is a non-profit association (vzw) that brings together existing Dutch organizations and initiatives in and around Brussels and adds network drinks several times a year. This platform aims to coordinate Dutch-oriented activities, disseminates relevant information and invitations and is a link between supply and demand for Dutch people in and around Brussels.
profile_positions.title: Co-Lead Events Committee, Host Orange Art House & Dutch Network Brussels Member

profile_positions.description:
Space Law and Policy: Promote - Enhance - Foster

The European Centre for Space Law (ECSL) was established in 1989 under the auspices of the European Space Agency (ESA) and with the support of a number of pioneers in this field. It is founded on the basis of a Charter, last amended in 2009.

Current members of the ECSL include professionals working in a wide range of areas within the space sector, lawyers, university professors and students.

Among other things, one of the main objectives of the Centre is to provide a forum for all those wishing to participate in constructive dialogue related to space law, and to encourage interdisciplinary exchange among members.

The ESA-ECSL Space Debris Regulation, Standards and Tools Workshop (19th to the 21st of March 2019 at ESA ESOC in Darmstadt, Germany).

Space activities are expanding in terms of both volume and geographical distribution of space actors. As a consequence, many governments are currently seeking to embrace the dynamic development in their countries by establishing the required regulatory and administrative framework. Space debris mitigation is a challenge often addressed in this context, as it not only involves law-making but also requires implementation according to standards and a transparent verification process.

This interdisciplinary workshop aims to assist legislators, mission designers and approving authorities in addressing space debris at their respective levels in a coherent way and according to best current practices. At the same time, this workshop will provide a platform for all of them to network and share their experience.
profile_positions.title: European Centre for Space Law (ECSL) Member & Space Debris Workshop Invitee (19-21 March 2019🇩🇪)

profile_positions.description:
A centre with the aim of fostering the development of the European #spaceeconomy and to boost the commercialisation of #space activities in Europe. 

The main objective of European Centre for Space Economy and Commerce (ECSECO) is to provide a European platform for interdisciplinary discussions and research on space economy and commerce.

An important milestone in realising a key pillar of #Agenda2025: to boost commercialisation of the European space sector.

Europe-wide CASSINI Hackathons are a major opportunity to develop ideas for a digital application building on space data, including satellite images and positioning services. They are particularly addressed to students, graduates, researchers and teams/start-ups in their very early stages.  Each hackathon takes place simultaneously in ten European cities and the local organisers will offer everything you need to form a great team, learn about accessing space data, identifying customer needs, and start working on your digital solution.

Together with Emile Sonneveld & Roderick De Cock I won the 4th CASSINI Hackathon in Belgium with Generic Green Investment Planner for Professionals using Satellite Imagery🏆: A tool to find, qualify, quantify, and prioritise green investing opportunities, it identifies unused land which has potential to be used as solar farms.
profile_positions.title: European Centre for Space Economy & Commerce (ECSECO) Member & 4th CASSINI Hackathon 2022🇧🇪 Winner

profile_positions.description: Contribute ideas with young people about the services provided by Dienst Uitvoering Onderwijs - DUO.

profile_positions.description:
• Envisioning a community of Space Influencers able to educate, inspire and entertain as we aim to venture beyond the stars.

• World’s first online community-based network dedicated to connect young space professionals, enthusiasts, and space industry leaders.

• Vision: Bring awareness to the (new) space industry and make space knowledge accessible to all people from all fields. 

• Mission: Connecting the young (new) space professionals with (new) space industry leaders and encouraging collaboration between different sectors.

NL Space Campus is the meeting place for the international space sector, with ESA ESTEC, the ESA BIC, the Galileo Reference Centre (GRC) and the Space Expo as inseparable anchor points. It should become a central place for the space community where entrepreneurs, educational institutions, research organisations, government organisations and other (societal) stakeholders meet, initiate cooperation and stimulate and facilitate the sharing of knowledge, aimed at the application of space knowledge, data and technology.

The EUSPA Academy training programme for entrepreneurs and start-ups interested in learning the secret recipe to successfully launch a downstream space business.

It offers a unique comprehensive curriculum with modular learning journeys to explore the potential of space data.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder, NL Space Campus Partner, EUSPA Space Academy Alumni & International Officer

profile_positions.description:
The West Wing is a think-tank connected to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Kingdom of the Netherlands. The think-tank was founded in 2015 and contains students and young professionals with an interests in developing and advising on (foreign) policy.

One of the clients of The West Wing - the International Market Organization and Trade Policy Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs - organised a summer school on trade policy challenges!

Clingendael - the Netherlands Institute of International Relations - is an independent think tank and academy on international affairs, based in The Hague. Through their analyses, training and public debate they aim to inspire and equip governments, businesses, and civil society in order to contribute to a secure, sustainable and just world. Ranked #25 in the world and #3 in Western Europe.
profile_positions.title: West Wing Alumni, Delegate Summer School Commercial Policy Challenges & Clingendael Events

volunteer_experiences.description: The Netherlands Space Society (NVR) is the foremost platform for space professionals from or working in Holland.

volunteer_experiences.role: SGAC Mentorship Program Alumni & Mentor
volunteer_experiences.description:
The Space Generation Advisory Council in Support of the United Nations Programme on Space Applications is a global non-governmental, non-profit (US 501(c)3) organisation and network which aims to represent university students and young space professionals ages 18-35 to the United Nations, space agencies, industry, and academia. The SGAC network of members, volunteers and alumni has grown to more than 16,000 members representing more than 165 countries.

SGAC created the mentorship program for its members in order to help connect SGAC members with experts in the space sector, especially through our vast network of SGAC Alumni. The mentorship program aims at connecting mentees and mentors in order to provide guidance, give personalized advice, and support to mentees from the different mentors.

company.name: EUSPA - EU Agency for the Space Programme

volunteer_experiences.description:
The training programme for entrepreneurs and start-ups interested in learning the secret recipe to successfully launch a downstream space business.

It offers a unique comprehensive curriculum with modular learning journeys to explore the potential of space data.

volunteer_experiences.role: Abstract Programme Mentor, Delegate IAC 2020-2022 & GLEX 2021
volunteer_experiences.description:
The IAF is continuing the successful Abstract Mentor Programme (AMP), which was introduced in 2018, with the objective of helping young or less experienced researchers improve their abstracts before submitting them, to increase the chance of their work being accepted for presentation at International Astronautical Congress.

Mentors will be paired with early career mentees based on their common field of interests (Science & Exploration, Applications & Operations, Technology, Infrastructure, Space & Society). 

The International Astronautical Congress (IAC) is the one place and time of the year where all global space actors come together. The event attracts more than 6,000 participants each year. Covering all space sectors and topics, it offers everyone the latest space information and developments in academia and industry, networking opportunities, contacts and potential partnerships.

The International Astronautical Federation (IAF) and ROSCOSMOS are organizing the Global Space Exploration Conference (GLEX) 2021 that will take place in St. Petersburg, Russian Federation from 14 – 18 June 2021.

volunteer_experiences.role: National Coordinator Belgium, Founder Benelux Hub, Delegate World Summit AI & ESA OpenDay
volunteer_experiences.description:
World Space Week is an international celebration of science and technology, and their contribution to the betterment of the human condition. The United Nations General Assembly declared in 1999 that World Space Week will be held each year from October 4-10. 

The world’s leading and largest AI summit gathers the global AI ecosystem of Enterprise, BigTech, Startups, Investors and Science, the brightest brains in AI as speakers every October in Amsterdam. 

ESA’s Open Day in the Netherlands on Sunday 6 October – your chance to meet astronauts, space experts and see behind the scenes of Europe’s space adventure at ESA’s largest establishment.

volunteer_experiences.role: Climate Platform Partner
volunteer_experiences.description:
The Benelux climate platform is a unique network that brings together all relevant climate stakeholders in the Benelux region. This is your gateway to get in touch with other stakeholders, share ideas and projects; gather resources; and be in touch with intergovernmental organisations that are in contact with the national governments as well as internationally relevant organisations.

In short, the climate platform is a stepping stone in bundling power to further a sustainable future.

volunteer_experiences.role: Young Professional Workshop Public Affairs at the UN “Building back better through multilateral public affairs”
volunteer_experiences.description: In this workshop, Dr2 and a representative from the Dutch Permanent Representation to the United Nations highlight the main takeaways of this years’ UNGA. How will it determine the regional and national policy agenda for themes like tech and climate in the years to come? In a short workshop, we will consequently outline why a good multilateral public affairs strategy is important, as well as map out main strategies and opportunities – like events and policy meetings - for businesses to participate in the policy-making process.

volunteer_experiences.role: Holland on the Hill participant

company.name: Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in the USA

volunteer_experiences.description:
For more than 400 years, the Netherlands and the United States have enjoyed an economic relationship based on their shared values of freedom, justice and entrepreneurship.

To highlight these shared values, the Holland on the Hill program was launched in 2014. Holland on the Hill is a joint effort program of the US Congressional Caucus on the Kingdom of the Netherlands, the Royal Netherlands Embassy, corporate partners, and the Netherland-America Foundation.

By organizing a yearly program of special events including lunches on specific themes, lectures by captains of industry and festive receptions, Holland on the Hill focuses on outreach on topics that are relevant for Americans and the Dutch. The Heineken Award Ceremony, the Anne Frank Award Ceremony and the end-of-year reception are examples of events that are organized on a yearly basis.

volunteer_experiences.role: Focus Group Member
volunteer_experiences.description: Debating Europe is organising a series of focus groups to understand your experience of trust and safety online. How do you determine what information to trust on the Internet? Do you "fact-check" the things you read? What are your trusted sources and where do you get your news? How do you stay safe online, protecting yourself from risks such as personal data breaches?

On behalf of the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) Youth Forum organizing committee, I’m accepted to the 10th anniversary United Nations ECOSOC Youth Forum.

With a invitation from United Nations Foundation I'm joining a conversation about Our Future Agenda with the Deputy Secretary-General of the United Nations and the Secretary-General’s Envoy on Youth.

With a invitation from Youth and Environment Europe I'm joining a conversation about European Youth Consultation on Climate Change together with the members of the UN Youth Envoy Secretary General’s Youth Advisory Group on Climate Change.

volunteer_experiences.role: Delegate EO-SSO/MineSense/European Space Week/EO Φ-WEEK/ECSL Workshop Space Debris
volunteer_experiences.description:
The name Earth Online derives from ESA's Earthnet programme. Earthnet prepares and attracts new ESA Earth Observation missions by setting the international cooperation scheme, preparing the basic infrastructure, building the scientific and application Community and competency in Europe to define and set-up own European Programmes in consultation with member states.

The MineSense group provide a platform for stakeholders of the mining and space industries to collaborate and discuss new technologies, opportunities, and solutions to solve challenges of mining industry using space technology.

The European Space Week brings together business, policy-makers, international experts and the space application user community. The event will present first-hand insights into the European Union’s Space Programmes Copernicus and Galileo and updates on the New Space Economy, as well as discussing how space solutions can contribute to a sustainable Europe and a sustainable future.

ESA-ECSL Space Debris Workshop (Regulation, Standards and Tools) aims to assist legislators, mission designers and approving authorities in addressing space debris at their respective levels in a coherent way and according to best current practices.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member
volunteer_experiences.description:
Through its activities the Netherlands British Chamber of Commerce has been promoting a broad approach to sustainability and corporate responsibility. Several of its fora provide useful platforms to engage among others in sustainability, diversity & inclusion and creating partnerships together.

As an organisation the NBCC adheres to the principles of accountability and transparency, ethical behavior, respect for stakeholder interests and for the rule of law, incl. international norms of environmental and social behavior. We believe a healthy business culture is built around strong ethics, integrity, respect and transparency. By showing commitment we attract like-minded partners and contribute to sustainable social and economic impacts. The NBCC and its members endorse sustainable development and social responsibilities of British-Dutch businesses within the framework of their entrepreneurial actions. 

Stakeholder engagement is one of our top priorities. The NBCC values insights both from inside and outside its business networks, which help to shape, advance and implement CSR and SDG strategies by sharing best policies and practices. Furthermore, with their diverse individual policies and practices, our members contribute to prosperity and at the same time engage in business activities in harmony with the environment and society.

volunteer_experiences.role: Delegate Utrecht URIP of Horizon 2020 Project Naturvation
volunteer_experiences.description: One of the central features of NATURVATION is the formation of Urban-Regional Innovation Partnerships (URIPs) in six European city-regions (Barcelona, Győr, Leipzig, Malmö, Newcastle, Utrecht). The URIPs provide a space for dialogue and learning throughout NATURVATION and are integrated into each element of the project’s work programme. An iterative programme of meetings is designed to provide participants with a common focus, informed by the ongoing work being undertaken in the project, and to develop city-specific insights that can be fed back into the work programme. An ongoing process of reporting captures the key aspects of each discussion and feeds this back into specific tasks in order to promote the co-development of knowledge, insights and outputs from the project.
